name: Fantasy Calendar Pack
description: Fantasy RPG calendar collection for D&D 5e, Pathfinder, Critical Role, and other fantasy settings

calendars.name: Athasian Calendar (Dark Sun)
calendars.description: The harsh calendar of the dying world of Athas from the Dark Sun D&D setting. Features a complex system of named years that cycle through 77 different combinations, with intercalary periods marking the deadly seasonal extremes.
calendars.preview: Sample format from D&D Dark Sun
calendars.author: David Raynes

calendars.name: Sword Coast Calendar (D&D 5e)
calendars.description: The Calendar of Harptos used along the Sword Coast and throughout the Forgotten Realms, in the years following the Spellplague and the Second Sundering.
calendars.preview: Sample format from D&D 5e Forgotten Realms
calendars.author: David Raynes

calendars.name: Eberron Calendar (D&D)
calendars.description: The Galifar Calendar used in the D&D Eberron campaign setting. Features twelve months of 28 days each, creating a perfectly regular 336-day year with no leap years.
calendars.author: David Raynes

calendars.name: Exandrian Calendar (Critical Role)
calendars.description: The calendar system used in Critical Role's world of Exandria, featuring unique month names and festival days. Created by Matthew Mercer for his campaign world.
calendars.author: David Raynes

calendars.name: Forbidden Lands Calendar
calendars.description: The calendar system used in the Forbidden Lands, featuring eight months that follow the eternal cycle of seasons rising and waning in this post-apocalyptic fantasy world.
calendars.preview: Sample format from Forbidden Lands RPG
calendars.author: David Raynes

calendars.name: Calendar of Harptos (Forgotten Realms)
calendars.description: The standard calendar of Faer√ªn, featuring twelve 30-day months interspersed with festival days that fall outside the normal monthly structure. Used throughout the Forgotten Realms in D&D campaigns.
calendars.preview: Sample format from D&D Forgotten Realms
calendars.author: David Raynes

calendars.name: Golarion Calendar (Pathfinder 2e)
calendars.description: The Absalom Reckoning calendar system used throughout Golarion, the campaign setting for Pathfinder Second Edition. Features twelve months with leap years following Gregorian rules.
calendars.author: David Raynes

calendars.name: Greyhawk Calendar (D&D)
calendars.description: The Common Year calendar system used in the World of Greyhawk, the classic D&D campaign setting. Features twelve months and four festival weeks that fall outside normal monthly structure.
calendars.author: David Raynes

calendars.name: Symbaroum Calendar
calendars.description: The calendar system used in the dark fantasy world of Symbaroum, featuring twelve months of 30 days each, named for their seasonal characteristics and agricultural significance.
calendars.author: David Raynes

calendars.name: Traditional Fantasy Calendar (Epoch-based)
calendars.description: A classic fantasy calendar that starts from year 1 and advances time from the beginning of the age. Perfect for traditional fantasy campaigns where worldTime=0 means the dawn of the current era.
calendars.author: David Raynes

calendars.name: The Vale Reckoning
calendars.description: A fantasy calendar used in northern mountain valleys, where each season breathes myth and memory. Features an 8-month cycle, 6-day week, and sacred festival days.
calendars.author: David Raynes

calendars.name: Imperial Calendar (Warhammer Fantasy)
calendars.description: The calendar of the Empire in the Old World, featuring irregular months and feast days that mark the passage of seasons in the grim darkness of the Warhammer Fantasy setting.
calendars.author: David Raynes
